com.opencredo.concourse.mapping.events.methods.state

Class StateBuilder<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.opencredo.concourse.mapping.events.methods.state.StateBuilder<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the state object to build.

    public final class StateBuilder<T>
extends Object
    Builds a state object by replaying events from an EventSource and dispatching them to state class methods.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Optional<T> buildState(CachedEventSource cachedEventSource, UUID aggregateId)
      Fetch events from the supplied CachedEventSource, and use them to build a state object for the supplied aggregate id.
      Optional<T> buildState(CachedEventSource cachedEventSource, UUID aggregateId, TimeRange timeRange)
      Fetch events within the supplied TimeRange from the supplied CachedEventSource, and use them to build a state object for the supplied aggregate id.
      Optional<T> buildState(EventSource eventSource, UUID aggregateId)
      Fetch events from the supplied EventSource, and use them to build a state object for the supplied aggregate id.
      Optional<T> buildState(EventSource eventSource, UUID aggregateId, TimeRange timeRange)
      Fetch events within the supplied TimeRange from the supplied EventSource, and use them to build a state object for the supplied aggregate id.
      Map<UUID,T> buildStates(CachedEventSource cachedEventSource, Collection<UUID> aggregateIds)
      Fetch events from the supplied CachedEventSource, and use them to build state objects for the supplied aggregateids.
      Map<UUID,T> buildStates(CachedEventSource cachedEventSource, Collection<UUID> aggregateIds, TimeRange timeRange)
      Fetch events within the supplied TimeRange from the supplied CachedEventSource, and use them to build state objects for the supplied aggregateids.

      Fetch events from the supplied EventSource, and use them to build state objects for the supplied aggregateids.
      Map<UUID,T> buildStates(EventSource eventSource, Collection<UUID> aggregateIds, TimeRange timeRange)
      Fetch events within the supplied TimeRange from the supplied EventSource, and use them to build state objects for the supplied aggregateids.
      static <T> StateBuilder<T> forStateClass(Class<? extends T> stateClass)
      Create a StateBuilder for the supplied state class.

      • forStateClass

        public static <T> StateBuilder<T> forStateClass(Class<? extends T> stateClass)
        Create a StateBuilder for the supplied state class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the state object to build.
        Parameters:
        stateClass - The class of the state object to build.
        Returns:
        The constructed StateBuilder.

      • buildState

        public Optional<T> buildState(EventSource eventSource,
                              UUID aggregateId)
        Fetch events from the supplied EventSource, and use them to build a state object for the supplied aggregate id.
        Parameters:
        eventSource - The EventSource to use to fetch events.
        aggregateId - The aggregate id to fetch events for.
        Returns:
        The constructed state object, or Optional::empty if the aggregate has no state.

      • buildState

        public Optional<T> buildState(EventSource eventSource,
                              UUID aggregateId,
                              TimeRange timeRange)
        Fetch events within the supplied TimeRange from the supplied EventSource, and use them to build a state object for the supplied aggregate id.
        Parameters:
        eventSource - The EventSource to use to fetch events.
        aggregateId - The aggregate id to fetch events for.
        timeRange - The TimeRange to restricts the replayed events to.
        Returns:
        The constructed state object, or Optional::empty if the aggregate has no state.

        public Map<UUID,T> buildStates(EventSource eventSource,
                               Collection<UUID> aggregateIds)

        Parameters:

        aggregateIds - The aggregate ids to fetch events for.
        Returns:
        The constructed state objects, mapped by aggregate id.
